{"step_by_step_thinking": "The specific plaque hypothesis suggests that only certain types of bacteria present in dental plaque are responsible for the pathogenicity of the plaque, leading to diseases such as periodontitis and caries. It does not suggest that all plaque is pathogenic, nor does it suggest that plaque is only pathogenic when signs of disease are present. It also does not limit the pathogenicity to caries only.", "answer_choice": "B"}
